page.title: 11IN THE NEWS
page.content: The reporters on the Esher News and Mail gave us their impressions of the issues of current concern.They range form quite weighty matters of local concern to the question of the thickness of the black,plastic dustbin liners which are issued by the Council for residents to put their rubbish in. The constant threat to the Green Belt by property developers is a frequent news item. Perennial issues include complaints about the noise nuisance of overhead aeroplane and helicopter routes,the existence of unofficial gypsy campsites and the increasing build up of traffic hroughout the area and the attendant parking problems. Another cause of recent concern is the shake-up of education and the closures and mergers of local schools.
